intro: Mitscherlichia rubrosetulosa, commonly known as the red-fruited mitscherlichia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red, velvety fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its ornamental value is due to its showy flowers and unique fruit structure.
